intro: Symphyandra zangezura, commonly known as the Zangezur symphyandra, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Symphyandraceae and is characterized by its unique morphology, including its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a cool, temperate climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human disturbance.
